Question: Still in his 40s, this person was minister to France from 1785 to 1789, the year the French Revolution started.
Hints: Shortly before leaving office, in March 1809, this person signed the repeal of the disastrous Embargo.
This person's eldest daughter Martha, known as Patsy, went with him to France in 1784.
By May 1826 this person's health was so frail that he was virtually a shut-in and by June he was confined to bed.
